dialog.line: Majestic spirit, it is an honor to …
Billowing, smoke, darkening, sky, gathering, fly.

dialog.question: Billowing, smoke, darkening, sky, gathering, fly.

dialog.line: You seem to speak of dark omens. The volcano?
Dear bird you seem distressed, whatever’s wrong?
Look I’m very sorry my feathered friend, but I really don’t have time for the wordplay.
Billowing smoke is darkening the sky, A darkening earth brings the cold,
The migrating flocks are gathering now, But soon my precious flocks must fly!
Of course - the Volcano threatens your flock. But then why the worry? What holds back the migration?
The flock when migrating, it is a following, We need a following, swift, bright and quick
We need a gathering, a unity, a following, Alas conflict weights us from flight

dialog.question: We need a gathering, a unity, a following, Alas conflict weights us from flight

dialog.line: Please let me help you with this conflict
The old one acts kindly, swiftly, brightly, We accept this generosity, humbly yes.
Once this problem finds resolution, Answers to your own I promise you will find.
Thank you, I hope I can help.
The Old One has questions?
Maybe we could make a trade?
The old one weighs purpose against need, Their need a folly, our purpose life’s cycle.
Accepted is the trade, briskly, coldly and vexed, Help this bird, and a path you will find.
Thank you, I’ll do my best to help your flock
The Old One has questions?
Forget the little picture, help me stop the volcano!
The old one speaks to a folly, a hubris, a broken want. As time ebbs and rivers flow, the mountain will meet an end.
Yet ends bring new dawns, so mourn not for yesterday, Help this bird, and your folly you may find anyway.
While I’m sorry we disagree oh mighty Kami, I will help you if allows me forward on my path.
The Old One has questions?
How do you imagine I bring about this peace between your bird tribes?
The flocks need one who can speak for the following, Speak to that conflict churning, bubbling,
To distill a distain, a bird who sings fair, To calm two proud kings, a bird who sings true
We need your help in this unearthing, Find the one urgently, A one to find our way
Sounds like ‘bird-peace’ need a mediator. I’m sure there’s some bird out there who will fit the bill.
You talk of a mediator – any characteristics I should be looking out for?
Find the bird who nurtures, shelters, fosters, The one who knows the gathering, but also sees its flocks,
Fierce yet loving, humble yet knowing, Others listen close to a song sung true
Nurturing, all-seeing, sings true. Got it! Now I just need to find this ‘bird-saint’!
Forgive me for asking but, what kind of being are you?
My essence is patterning, gathering, returning, All in flight wheeling, banking, turning
Follow from within new patterns underwing,
A Kami I am and these birds my flock
My Thanks kind spirit, I’ll be off now.
A chance, a change, a feeling underwing, fly my dear, fly!
It's me again
The Old One has questions?
